com.gotenna.sdk.bluetooth

Class GTConnectionManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gotenna.sdk.bluetooth.GTConnectionManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.bluetooth.BluetoothAdapter.LeScanCallback, com.gotenna.sdk.bluetooth.GTPeripheralHandler.GTPeripheralListener

    public class GTConnectionManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements android.bluetooth.BluetoothAdapter.LeScanCallback, com.gotenna.sdk.bluetooth.GTPeripheralHandler.GTPeripheralListener
    A singleton that handles scanning for and connecting to the goTenna. Created on 2/12/15.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  GTConnectionManager.GTConnectionListener
      Interface definition for a callback to be invoked when the connection state to the goTenna changes.
      static class  GTConnectionManager.GTConnectionState
      Used to indicate our current connection state to the goTenna.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Adds a GTConnectionManager.GTConnectionListener to listen for and receive updates about goTenna connection state changes.

      Will kill any existing BTLE connection with the goTenna.

      Will kill any existing BTLE connection with the goTenna and immediately search for the goTenna again.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static GTConnectionManager getInstance()
        The shared instance of the singleton.
        Returns:
        The singleton instance.

      • scanAndConnect

        public void scanAndConnect()
        If Bluetooth is enabled, will scan for a goTenna in the area and attempt to connect to it. If this device has connected to a goTenna before, it may specifically look for that goTenna. You can determined if we have connected to a goTenna before by using getConnectedGotennaAddress() You can also clear a remembered goTenna by calling clearConnectedGotennaAddress()

      • stopScan

        public void stopScan()
        Stops any current scanning for for a goTenna.

      • disconnectWithRetry

        public void disconnectWithRetry()
        Will kill any existing BTLE connection with the goTenna and immediately search for the goTenna again.

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Will kill any existing BTLE connection with the goTenna. Will stay disconnected until scanAndConnect() is called again.

      • getConnectedGotennaAddress

        public java.lang.String getConnectedGotennaAddress()
        When you connect to a goTenna for the first time, it will remember the hardware address of that specific goTenna and will not connect to any other goTenna devices.
        Returns:
        The hardware address of the goTenna

      • clearConnectedGotennaAddress

        public void clearConnectedGotennaAddress()
        Clears the remembered goTenna hardware address, allowing you to connect to other goTenna devices.

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Determines if we are currently connected to the goTenna or not.
        Returns:
        True if we are connected, false otherwise.

      • addGtConnectionListener

        public void addGtConnectionListener(GTConnectionManager.GTConnectionListener gtConnectionListener)
        Adds a GTConnectionManager.GTConnectionListener to listen for and receive updates about goTenna connection state changes.
        Parameters:
        gtConnectionListener - The listener to receive the callback updates.

      • removeGtConnectionListener

        public void removeGtConnectionListener(GTConnectionManager.GTConnectionListener gtConnectionListener)
        Removes a GTConnectionManager.GTConnectionListener to no longer listen for and receive updates about goTenna connection state changes.
        Parameters:
        gtConnectionListener - The listener to receive the callback updates.

      • getGtConnectionState

        public GTConnectionManager.GTConnectionState getGtConnectionState()
        Determines the current connection state to the goTenna.
        Returns:
        The current connection state.

      • writeCommand

        public void writeCommand(com.gotenna.sdk.commands.GTCommand command)
        Writes a command with packets to the goTenna. DO NOT USE!!! See GTCommandCenter instead.
        Parameters:
        command - The command to write.

      • onLeScan

        public void onLeScan(android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice device,
            int rssi,
            byte[] scanRecord)
        Description copied from interface: android.bluetooth.BluetoothAdapter.LeScanCallback
        Callback reporting an LE device found during a device scan initiated by the BluetoothAdapter.startLeScan(android.bluetooth.BluetoothAdapter.LeScanCallback) function.
        Specified by:
        onLeScan in interface android.bluetooth.BluetoothAdapter.LeScanCallback
        Parameters:
        device - Identifies the remote device
        rssi - The RSSI value for the remote device as reported by the Bluetooth hardware. 0 if no RSSI value is available.
        scanRecord - The content of the advertisement record offered by the remote device.
